what: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: x3p file format specified ISO standard 25178-72:2017/AMD 1:2020 (based ISO ISO5436 – 2000) describe 3d surface measurements. package allows reading, writing basic modifications 3D surface measurements.

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: x3ptools available CRAN: development version available Github:
code: install.packages("x3ptools") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("heike/x3ptools", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: x3p file format xml based file format created describe digital surface measurements. x3p developed OpenFMC (Open Forensic Metrology Consortium, see https://www.open-fmc.org/) adopted 25178-72:2017/AMD 1:2020. x3p files zip archive directory consisting xml file meta information matrix numeric surface measurements.

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: Internally, x3p objects stored list consisting surface matrix (measurements) meta information four records: header info, feature info, general info, matrix info: four info objects specify information Record1 Record4 xml file. example xml file provided package can accessed system.file("templateXML.xml", package="x3ptools"). header.info contains information relevant interpret locations surface matrix: matrix.info expands header.info provides link surface measurements binary format. general.info consists information data captured, .e. author capturing device specified . feature.info informed header info provides structure storing information. pieces can changed adapted manually, convenient save information capturing device creator separate template bind measurements meta information together command addtemplate_x3p.
code: library(x3ptools) logo <- read_x3p(system.file("csafe-logo.x3p", package="x3ptools")) names(logo) ## [1] "header.info"    "surface.matrix" "feature.info"   "general.info"   ## [5] "matrix.info" logo$header.info ## $sizeY ## [1] 419 ##  ## $sizeX ## [1] 741 ##  ## $incrementY ## [1] 6.45e-07 ##  ## $incrementX ## [1] 6.45e-07

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: read_x3p write_x3p two functions allows us read x3p files write x3p files.
code: logo <- read_x3p(system.file("csafe-logo.x3p", package="x3ptools")) names(logo) ## [1] "header.info"    "surface.matrix" "feature.info"   "general.info"   ## [5] "matrix.info"

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: function image_x3p uses rgl render 3d object separate window. user can interact 3d surface (zoom rotate):  case file name specified function call resulting surface saved file (extension determines actual file format image).
code: image_x3p(logo, size=c(741,419), zoom=0.5, useNULL=TRUE) rgl::rglwidget()

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: image_x3p_grid lays regularly spaced grid lines surface scan. Lines drawn spaces apart (50 microns default y direction 100 microns x direction). Every fifth tenth lines colored differently ease visual assessment distance.
code: logoplus <- x3p_add_grid(logo, spaces=50e-6,                           size = c(3,3,5), color=c("grey50", "black", "darkred")) image_x3p(logoplus, size=c(741,419), zoom=0.5, useNULL=TRUE) rgl::rglwidget() ## Warning in snapshot3d(scene = x, width = width, height = height): webshot = ## TRUE requires the webshot2 package and Chrome browser; using rgl.snapshot() ## instead

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: functions x3p_to_df df_to_x3p allow casting x3p format x-y-z data set: converting x3p format data frame, values surface matrix interpreted heights (saved value) x-y grid. dimension matrix sets number different x y levels, information header.info allows us scale levels measured quantities. Similarly, moving data frame surface matrix, assumption measurements taken equi-spaced complete grid x-y values. information resolution (.e. spacing consecutive x y locations) saved form header info, added list. General info feature info can extracted measurements, recorded means. data regular data frame, can use regular means visualize raster images, e.g. using ggplot2:
code: logo_df <- x3p_to_df(logo) head(logo_df) ##           x          y value ## 1 0.000e+00 0.00026961 4e-07 ## 2 6.450e-07 0.00026961 4e-07 ## 3 1.290e-06 0.00026961 4e-07 ## 4 1.935e-06 0.00026961 4e-07 ## 5 2.580e-06 0.00026961 4e-07 ## 6 3.225e-06 0.00026961 4e-07 library(ggplot2) library(magrittr)  logo_df %>% ggplot(aes( x= x, y=y, fill= value)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_gradient2(midpoint=4e-7)

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: rotate_x3p rotates x3p image steps 90 degrees, transpose_x3p transposes surface matrix image updates corresponding meta information. function y_flip_x3p combination transpose rotation, allows flip direction y axis move easily legacy ISO x3p scans ones conforming recent ISO standard.

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: sample_x3p allows sub-sample x3p object get lower resolution image. sample_x3p need set sampling factor. sample factor mX 2 means use every 2nd value surface matrix, mX 5 means, use every fifth value: Parameter can specified separately mX different sampling rate y direction. can also use different offsets x y direction specifying offsetX /offsetY.
code: dim(logo$surface.matrix) ## [1] 741 419 logo_sample <- sample_x3p(logo, m=5) dim(logo_sample$surface.matrix) ## [1] 149  84 sample2 <- sample_x3p(logo, m=5, offset=1) cor(as.vector(logo_sample$surface.matrix[-149,]), as.vector(sample2$surface.matrix)) ## [1] 0.8639308

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: interpolate_x3p allows, like sample_x3p, create new x3p file new resolution, specified parameters resx resy. new resolution lower (.e. larger values resx resy) resolution specified IncrementX IncrementY header info x3p file. interpolate_x3p can also used interpolate missing values (set parameter maxgap according specifications zoo::na.approx).

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: four records header info, feature info, general info, matrix info x3p object contain meta information relevant scan. x3p_show_xml allows user specify search term proceeds go records matching term. result matching elements meta file shown: search term identifies single element, x3p_modify_xml allows user update corresponding meta information:
code: logo %>% x3p_show_xml("axis") # three axes are defined ## $Axes.CX.AxisType ## [1] "I" ##  ## $Axes.CY.AxisType ## [1] "I" ##  ## $Axes.CZ.AxisType ## [1] "A" logo %>% x3p_show_xml("creator") ## $Creator ## [1] "Heike Hofmann, CSAFE" logo %>% x3p_modify_xml("creator", "I did this") ## x3p object ## Instrument: N/A  ## size (width x height): 741 x 419 in pixel  ## resolution: 6.4500e-07 x 6.4500e-07  ## Creator: I did this  ## Comment: image rendered from the CSAFE logo

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: mask used markup regions surface - mask can used overlay rendered surface color. 3d surface part bullet surface shown. regions marked : bronze colored area area strong striae (vertical lines engraved bullet moves barrel handgun fired), areas dark blue show groove engraved areas, light blue area shows break bottom bullet, pink area marks area without striae:  image can serve mask, command x3p_add_mask allows add raster image mask x3p object:  masks informative others, requirement images right size.
code: logo <- read_x3p(system.file("csafe-logo.x3p", package="x3ptools")) color_logo <- png::readPNG(system.file("csafe-color.png", package="x3ptools")) logoplus <- x3p_add_mask(logo, mask = as.raster(color_logo))  image_x3p(logoplus, size=c(741, 419), zoom=0.5, multiply = 30)

title: Tools for Working with 3D Surface Measurements
text: Masks raster images. change raster manifests change surface color corresponding scan. suggest using magick package manipulate masks. Additionally, vertical horizontal lines can added masks using commands x3p_add_vline x3p_add_hline:
code: logo <- read_x3p(system.file("csafe-logo.x3p", package="x3ptools")) logoplus <- x3p_add_hline(logo, yintercept=c(13e-5,19.5e-5), color="cyan") #image_x3p(logoplus, size=c(741, 419)/2, zoom=0.5, multiply = 30, file="man/figures/logo-lines.png")

title: Draw rectangle on the mask of an x3p file using rgl — x3p_select
code: if (FALSE) { if (interactive) {   if (!file.exists("fadul1-1.x3p")) {     url <- "https://tsapps.nist.gov/NRBTD/Studies/CartridgeMeasurement/DownloadMeasurement"     file <- "2d9cc51f-6f66-40a0-973a-a9292dbee36d"     download.file(file.path(url, file), destfile="fadul1-1.x3p")   }   x3p <- x3p_read("fadul1-1.x3p")   x3p_image(x3p, size=c(500,500), zoom=.8)   x3p <- x3p_select(x3p, update=TRUE, col="#FF0000")     logo <- x3p_read(system.file("csafe-logo.x3p", package="x3ptools"))   x3p_image(logo, size=c(500,500), zoom = 1)   x3p_select(logo, update=TRUE, col="#00FF00")  }}
